children.text: Okay, I need to translate this Python code into C. Let's start by understanding what the Python code does.

children.text: First, the Python code reads an integer n, which is the number of elements in the array. Then it reads a list of integers from input.
children.label: mental_execution

children.text: The code then checks each consecutive pair of elements in the array to see if their difference exceeds 15. The first time this happens, it prints the previous element plus 15. If none of the differences exceed 15, it checks the last element: if it's equal to 90 or adding 15 to it would reach or exceed 90, then it prints 90; otherwise it adds 15 to the last element and prints that. Now, translating to C. Hmm, okay, steps to take. First, in C, we can't read input as easily as Python's input().

children.text: We'll need to use scanf or maybe read from stdin using fgets then parse. But since the first input is an integer n, followed by n integers in a line, I'll need to handle that.

Wait, for the array part: in Python, the code uses list(map(int, input().split())) to split the input into integers. So in C, need to read a line of input and split it into integers, but maybe just read each integer one by one with scanf. Wait, maybe using scanf with whitespace delimiter. Because when using scanf with %d, it automatically skips whitespace, so perhaps just:

2. Read the next line, which has n integers into an array. 3. Then process the array as per the logic.

children.text:
Else, loop through elements starting from index 1 until the end:

Wait the Python code's loop is for i in range(1, len(arr)): So in C, for (i=1; i < n; i++). For each of those, check if arr[i] - arr[i-1] >15. If so, then print arr[i-1]+15 and break. If none of these conditions are met, then the code proceeds to the else part.
children.label: code_analysis

children.text: The else belongs to the for loop, which is a construct that's not available in C directly. Wait the Python code has an else clause after the for loop, which executes only if the loop completed normally without breaking. In C, that has to be simulated by using a flag.
children.label: language_mapping
